fr.upmc.components.examples.dynamic_cs.components

Class DynamicURIConsumer

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.upmc.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.upmc.components.examples.basic_cs.components.URIConsumer
        • fr.upmc.components.examples.dynamic_cs.components.DynamicURIConsumer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentI, DynamicallyConnectableI

    public class DynamicURIConsumer
extends URIConsumer
implements DynamicallyConnectableI
    The class DynamicURIConsumer is the dynamic version of the component URIConsumer of the basic client/server example. It merely adds to the later the dynamic connection service of the interface DynamicallyConnectableComponentI.

    Description

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 14 mars 2014

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      void connectWith(java.lang.String serverPortURI, java.lang.String clientPortURI, java.lang.String ccname)
      connect the ports through the given connector, one of the two given port URI must correspond to a port of the component executing this service.

      disconnect the ports through the given connector, one of the two given port URI must correspond to a port of the component executing this service.
      void getURIandPrint()
      method that implements the component's behaviour: call the URI service ten times and print the URI on the terminal, waiting a second between each call.
